;

;与目前在该行业工作的许多人一样，数字营销诞生于 20 世纪 90 年代。从那时起，该行业以惊人的速度发展，催生了更多类型的营销。

;

;从搜索引擎营销到基于帐户的营销，每个品牌都可以结合使用这些策略来吸引目标受众和增加收入。

;

;继续阅读以发现 2023 年及更多市场的顶级营销趋势。

;

;;;;

;

;;营销类型;

;

;;1.传统营销;

;

;传统营销是指互联网兴起之前，通过线下渠道进行的品牌推广。想想广告牌、传单、电视广告和广播节目。

;

;这些营销渠道对于某些品牌来说仍然发挥着重要作用。

;

;事实上，;针对 CMO 的全球调查;发现，超过 40% 的营销预算流向线下渠道 — 但如今，营销人员越来越依赖线下渠道数字替代品。

;

;;2.数字营销;

;

;;

;

;;;图片来源;;

;

;与传统营销相比，数字营销利用各种以前无法使用的技术来接触新的受众。

;

;这是;增长最快;的营销类型，涵盖所有营销在线努力。

;

;投资数字营销的企业使用大量数字渠道（例如搜索引擎、社交媒体、电子邮件、网站等）来与当前和潜在客户建立联系。

;

;;3.出站营销;

;

;出站营销是指未经请求的外向促销，例如推销电话、向购买列表发送电子邮件群发以及平面广告。

;

;这种营销方法称为“出站” ” 因为它涉及向消费者推送信息，以提高对您的产品或服务的认识 - 无论消费者是否表现出对它们的兴趣。

;

;在许多行业，出站营销已经发展;效果较差;，因为当今的消费者被如此多的营销中断所淹没，以至于他们通常需要更多地关注这些消息。

;

;;4.入站营销;

;

;然而，入站营销的重点是;吸引;客户，而不是打扰他们。

;

;入站销售线索都是;更有可能转化;并且获取成本更低，最近的一份报告发现入站潜在客户成本;比出境营销少 67%;。

;

;虽然有些;入站营销< /a>; 策略在线下进行，大多数都属于数字营销的范畴，因为消费者有权在线进行研究，以帮助他们在买家的旅程中取得进展。

;

;入站建立在三个支柱之上：吸引、参与并愉悦。最初的目标是创造有价值的内容和体验，与您的受众产生共鸣，并吸引他们加入您的业务。

;

;下一步是通过电子邮件营销、聊天机器人等对话工具吸引他们，当然，不断增加真正的价值。最后，通过充当长期的、富有同理心的顾问和专家来取悦他们。

;

;;5.搜索引擎营销;

;

;搜索引擎营销（SEM）包括确保您的业务在搜索引擎结果页面上可见的所有策略。借助 SEM，当用户搜索特定关键字时，您可以将您的业务推向首位。

;

;根据 HubSpot 的 2023 年;消费者趋势状况;报告显示，在线搜索是当今买家发现新产品的首要方式 - 因此确保您的业务出现在 Google 或 Bing 等搜索平台上至关重要.

;

;;

;

;;

;

;SEM 有两种类型：针对自然搜索结果的搜索引擎优化 (SEO) 和针对赞助搜索引擎结果的按点击付费 (PPC) 广告。

;

;要开始搜索引擎优化，请熟悉搜索引擎排名因素以及与您的行业和产品相关的常见关键字。然后，积极主动地为搜索引擎制作内容，以便将使用这些字词的内容编入索引。

;

;相反，PPC 涉及对关键字出价，以便通过 Google Ads 等平台投放您的广告。考虑投资;广告管理工具;来帮助您创建和管理 PPC 广告系列。

;

;< a class="cta_button" href="https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8835eaa3-be7b-4697-81d2-488e03708d34&pid=53&ecid=&hseid=&hsic= ">;;;

;

;;6.内容营销;

;

;作为吸引目标受众的最佳方式之一，内容营销是有效的数字入站营销策略的关键组成部分。

;

;这可能就是原因近;十分之九;的营销专业人士已经投资了内容营销计划来维持或在 2023 年增加投资。

;

;这种营销形式涉及通过免费和封闭的渠道（例如社交媒体平台、博客、视频、电子书和网络研讨会）向目标受众创建、发布和分发内容.

;

;;

;

;;;图片来源;;

;

;内容营销的目标是帮助您的受众完成他们的购买之旅，同时增加价值并提供支持性的、令人愉快的体验。

;

;为此，首先，在买家准备购买之前;确定他们可能会遇到的常见问题和疑虑。

;

;然后，创建一篇社论日历来跟踪您何时创建和共享与这些主题相关的内容。 A;内容管理系统; (CMS) 还可以帮助您保持井井有条，让您的内容和发布时间表步入正轨。

;

;;;;

;

;;7.社交媒体营销;

;

;借助;Facebook;等平台、Instagram、LinkedIn 和 Twitter，品牌可以以更加个性化的方式宣传其业务并与受众互动。

;

;社交媒体是;越来越有效的策略来吸引所有年龄段的买家，2023 年接受调查的婴儿潮一代消费者中有 24% 和 X 一代消费者中有 46% 表示他们在过去三个月的社交媒体。

;

;但是，对于社交媒体来说，有两个因素对成功至关重要：相关性和一致性。

;

;第一，相关性：没有人登录社交媒体正在寻找要购买的东西。因此，平衡促销与娱乐至关重要。

;

;吸引观众点赞、分享和评论的引人注目的图片和标题将使您的品牌更接近赢得客户。

; < p>;;

;

;;;图片来源;;

;

;现在，保持一致性：一致的发帖节奏将使您的关注者回归。如果他们很少在自己的时间轴上看到您的品牌，他们如何能对您的品牌进行投资？

;

;为了使跨平台发布内容变得可访问，一些社交媒体工具可以自动化该过程。

;

;; ;;

;

;;8.视频营销;

;

;;;;

;

;;;图片来源;;

;

;根据;最近的研究;，87% 的营销人员表示，将视频纳入他们的营销策略会带来积极的投资回报率。

;

;是否在您的网站、YouTube 频道、电子邮件通讯和/或社交媒体上，视频可以提高品牌知名度、产生转化并达成交易。

;

;一些;视频营销应用;甚至允许您根据潜在客户的活动来分析、培育和评分。

;

;;;;

;

;;9. 语音营销;

;

;语音营销既指通过纳入正确的关键字来优化您的语音搜索网站，也指利用 Amazon Alexa 和 Google Home 等智能扬声器为您的受众增加价值并回答有关他们感兴趣的主题的问题。

; < p>;考虑通过开发 Google Home 操作或 Alexa 技能来发挥创造力。例如，Uber 创建了 Alexa 技能，允许用户通过简单的语音请求来叫车。

;

;同样，TED 开发了该功能允许 Alexa 用户根据主题、语气或演讲者搜索和播放 TED 演讲。

;

;这些工具可能相对较新，但在营销人员中越来越受欢迎。

; < p>;HubSpot 的;2023 年营销趋势调查;发现，目前利用某种形式的语音营销计划的营销领导者中有 40%明年增加投资。

;

;;10.电子邮件营销;

;

;;

;

;;

;

;电子邮件营销通过电子邮件将品牌与潜在客户、潜在客户和现有客户联系起来。电子邮件营销活动可以提高品牌知名度、为其他渠道带来流量、推广产品或服务或培养购买线索。

;

;此外，;2022 年的一项研究;发现，每投资 1 美元，电子邮件营销的回报可能高达 36 美元。

;

;电子邮件可以是一种有效的工具，但它对于在法律限制范围内负责任地使用它。 ;GDPR; 和 ;《反垃圾邮件法案》; 要求品牌遵守负责任的商业电子邮件做法，可归结为三个原则：

;
    ;
  • ;仅向希望收到您消息的人（即已选择加入的人）发送电子邮件。
    • ;
  • ;让订阅者可以轻松选择退出。
    • ;
  • ;在联系时，请透明地说明您的身份以及您发送电子邮件的原因。
    • ;
;

;考虑到这些护栏，您需要做的第一件事就是制定策略，如何构建您的电子邮件列表或您的联系人数据库可以发送电子邮件。

;

;标准方法包括您网站上的潜在客户捕获表单或潜在客户开发合作伙伴关系。

;

;然后，您需要;电子邮件营销软件;和 CRM，用于发送、跟踪和监控电子邮件的有效性。

;

;推送您的电子邮件策略更上一层楼并最大限度地提高生产力，您可能还需要了解;电子邮件自动化软件;，根据触发条件发送电子邮件。

;

;要了解有关电子邮件营销的详细信息，请免费使用;来自 HubSpot Academy 的电子邮件营销课程;。

;

;;;;

;

;;11. 对话式营销;

;

;对话式营销是指与受众进行任何形式的 1:1 对话。< /p>;

;这可以说是与客户联系的最自然的方式之一，研究表明对话可以是;消除购买过程中的摩擦;。

;

;以客户想要的方式、时间和地点与他们见面至关重要。因此，这些对话可以跨多个渠道发生。

;

;这不仅仅是;直播聊天;：它扩展到电话、短信、Facebook Messenger、电子邮件、Slack 和许多其他媒体。

;

;开始时，您将首先确定您的聊天渠道观众是最活跃的。

;

;这可能听起来相对简单，但在管理多个渠道同时避免响应时间过长、内部沟通不畅或生产力损失时，事情可能会变得棘手。

;

;这就是原因使用;对话式营销工具;（例如统一收件箱）可能会有所帮助，简化您的工作。

;

;;12.口碑营销;

;

;;口碑营销;是一种病毒式营销策略，利用令人耳目一新的创意内容、互动活动和社区影响者，以产生口碑营销和对品牌即将推出的产品或服务的预期。

;

;这种营销方法基于;研究支持的;心理效应，例如 FOMO（害怕错过）和 Baader-Meinhof 现象（也称为频率错觉，在遇到新产品后，消费者开始感觉他们无处不在）。

;

;当您尽早接触有影响力的人并制定计划以围绕您的品牌引起轰动时，口碑营销效果最佳。

; < p>;此外，为了跟踪您的努力的有效性，请投资;社交聆听软件;，它将为您提供帮助密切关注观众的反应。

;

;;13.影响者营销;

;

;;;;

;

;;;图片来源;;

;

;通过与您所在领域的影响者合作，影响者营销可以增强您的品牌进入由高度参与的社交媒体追随者组成的现有社区。;

;影响者被认为是各自领域的专家，并且与您想要接触的受众建立了忠诚度和信任。

;

;这些计划是现代营销策略的重要组成部分：

;

;如今，;88% 的营销人员; 拥有专门的影响者营销预算，;四分之一;社交媒体用户表示购买2023 年基于影响者推荐的产品。

;

;要开始影响者营销，您必须首先制定影响者营销策略并定义您希望与哪种类型的影响者合作。

; < p>;然后，您需要为影响者创建标准，以确保他们符合您的策略和预算。

;

;要考虑的因素包括他们的利基、受众规模以及当前指标。从那里，您可以通过以下方式找到有影响力的人并与他们联系：

;
    ;
  • ;在社交媒体上手动联系他们。
    • ;
  • ;使用有影响力的营销平台。
    • ;
  • ; >;聘请一家机构为您进行研究和推广。
    • ;
;

;;;获客营销;侧重于“吸引”和“转化”阶段，您的目标是将陌生人变成销售合格的潜在客户。

;

;获取与其他营销类型的区别在于，它超越了营销团队，通常涉及与客户服务和成功团队的协作。

;

;为什么？因为满意的客户是您最大的推动者。

;

;获取营销可能涉及多种策略，为您的组织创建潜在客户生成引擎。

;

;这些策略可以包括提供免费增值产品、推出教育中心、加强网站文案、;转化率优化;和潜在客户优化。

; < p>;它可能包括;潜在客户优化和培育策略;，以促进营销和销售之间的交接。

;

;;15.情境营销;

;

;情境营销是指根据在线用户独特的在线浏览行为，在网站和社交媒体网络上针对在线用户投放不同的广告。

;

;超过 40%在最近的一项研究中， 的受访者表示，他们更有可能从;专门针对他们定制广告;，这表明这种针对具体情况的方法可以对您的转化率产生重大影响.

;

;那么，如何才能将其付诸实践？

;

;A; CRM< /a>; 结合;强大的营销工具;（例如智能 CTA）可以使网站看起来更像是“选择你自己的冒险”故事，使用户能够找到他们需要的信息并快速有效地采取行动。

;

;当然，情境营销需要策略和仔细的规划。要正确开始，请查看 HubSpot 的免费;情境营销课程;。

;

;;16。个性化营销;

;

;;;;

;

;;;图片来源;;

;

;个性化营销旨在创建;为您品牌中的每个用户提供定制的营销体验;。

;

;这可以很简单，只需在电子邮件的主题行中添加用户的姓名或根据过去的购买情况发送产品推荐。

;

;例如，;Versium Reach; 等软件产品使营销人员可以轻松定位他们的目标B2B 或 B2C 客户拥有强大、个性化的受众洞察。

;

;当然，这种营销很容易意外地让人感到毛骨悚然。

;

;但是，研究表明，消费者个性化体验令人惊讶，主要是当它们提高便利性并实现更愉快的购买旅程时。

;

;例如，;最近的一份报告; 发现，只要营销人员仅使用消费者知情且直接与其共享的数据，十分之七的消费者就可以接受个性化。

;

;;17.品牌营销;

;

;品牌营销包括您为;塑造品牌的公众认知;所做的一切，以及与目标受众建立情感联系。这包括讲故事、创造力、幽默和灵感。

;

;目标是发人深省并产生富有成效的对话，以便您的品牌被记住并与积极情绪联系在一起。

;

;Don'不要低估引人入胜的故事的力量：哈佛大学心理学家杰罗姆·布鲁纳的研究表明，事实;如果作为故事的一部分分享，被记住的可能性会增加 22 倍;。

;

;开始品牌营销中，您必须深入;了解您的买家角色;以及什么能与他们产生共鸣。您还必须考虑您在市场中的地位以及您与竞争对手的区别。

;

;这可以帮助塑造您的价值观和您的立场，为您的;讲故事活动;。

;

;;;;

;

;;18。隐形营销;

;

;当品牌向消费者推销其产品或服务时，这些消费者并没有意识到自己正在向其推销产品或服务。

;

;例如，如果您“当您正在观看电视节目并且品牌产品融入到镜头中时，您可能刚刚处于隐形营销活动的接收端。

;

;只要您和与您合作的任何有影响力的人都留在范围内任何相关广告披露法规的限制 - 并避免;不道德或误导性的活动; - 隐形营销可能是一种有效的广告方式您的产品。

;

;但要使这种营销方式发挥作用，品牌必须找到与其品牌形象和价值观相符的机会。

;

;;19.游击营销;

;
;
;
; ;
;
;
;

;游击营销通过在人流量大的物理地点进行大胆、巧妙的品牌激活来传播品牌知名度。

;

;游击营销的示例包括改变户外城市环境、在现场活动期间进行促销（未经赞助商或其他人的许可）组织者）、公共特技和寻宝。

;

;这可能是一种获得广泛关注的经济有效的方式。

;

;但是，如果观众需要，非常规的游击策略也可能适得其反。理解它们，被认为麻木不仁，或者被天气条件、执法或其他品牌无法控制的因素打断。

;

;如果您正在寻找灵感，请查看此;有效的游击营销示例列表;，从纽约街头散落的 Bounty 真人大小的冰棒和咖啡杯到 Deadpool 的 Tinder 个人资料。< /p>;

;;20。原生营销;

;

    ;What is Dunbar's number?

    ;

    ;Dunbar's number, theorized by anthropologist ;Robin Dunbar;, is the number of ;stable social relationships; a person can maintain simultaneously. He believed the maximum number is 150, which is why this is sometimes called the “Rule of 150.”

    ;

    ;“The core of Dunbar's number still holds an essential truth: the value of deep and meaningful connections,” shared ;Lachlan Brown;, an expert in behavioral psychology.

    ;

    ;So, how can a deeper understanding of psychological limits help us foster more profound and meaningful relationships?

    ; ;;

    ;Why Dunbar's Number Matters

    ;

    ;While learning that there's a cap on our relationships may not feel inherently positive, there's a benefit to understanding our limits.

    ;

    ;Realistic Expectations

    ;

    ;Managing your network starts with having realistic expectations. This makes nurturing and growing your network less intimidating and, ultimately, more successful.

    ;

    ;While it's the goal, a practical understanding of your network is not as easy to achieve as it might sound.

    ;

    ;“I've interviewed and taken data points on networking from thousands of people. I've come to realize that most people have a false sense of their networks,” said Adam Connors, founder of ;NetWorkWise;.

    ;

    ;“Some feel that the 1,100 people they are connected with on Facebook or LinkedIn are their networks, and they are well networked or connected. On the other hand, you have others who don't think they know many people at all. The truth is, it's really somewhere in between, especially when you start getting more granular with your Spheres of Influence.”

    ;

    ;Understanding Dunbar's number and the different layers of your sphere of influence helps you set realistic expectations and successfully prioritize the vast relationships within your network.

    ;

    ;Relationship Prioritization

    ;

    ;Prioritizing relationships might have an unsavory tone, like secretly having a favorite child, but it's a natural and rational way to view the varied people within your network.

    ;

    ;“I find Dunbar's number logical. The importance of close social circles has been recognized for decades,” said Dr. Alexander Lapa, a psychiatrist from ;Rehab Guide;. But conversely, there are benefits to having an extensive network as well.

    ;

    ;Dr. Lapa explained that the theory states that there are social layers, and each has different limits, which he says can resemble a pattern like this.

    ;
      ;
    • ;Loved ones: 5 people
      • ;
    • ; Close friends: 15 people
      • ;
    • ;Friends: 50 people
      • ;
    • ;Meaningful contact: 150 people
      • ;
    • ;Acquaintances: 500 people
      • ;
    • ;People you recognize: 1,500 people
      • ;
    ;

    ;Understanding apparent differences between the layers of your network can help you correctly allocate the right amount of energy to fuel those ongoing relationships.

    ;

    ;Energy Allocation

    ;

    ;In networking, it's essential to know that ;the appropriate amount of energy required from your inner circle is not the same as your professional contacts;.

    ;

    ;This can be a comfort for managing scores of colleagues, clients, team members, and customers.

    ;

    ;“Remember that networking connections don't require the same attention as personal relationships,” said Lily Zay, marketer at ;HiHello;, advises.

    ;

    ;She shared these techniques for maintaining professional relationships while managing your energy output:

    ;
      ;
    • ; Reach out to connections ;at an interval ;that works for you, such as once a quarter or twice a year.
      • ;
    • ;Don't be afraid to be ;opportunistic ;when a touchpoint presents itself.
      • ;
    • ;Take advantage of commenting on their LinkedIn posts or sending an article ;relevant to them;.
      • ;
    ;

    ;“Using tactics like this helps maintain a relationship with a lower lift on your part so that you can keep up with even more connections.”

    ;

    ;With all of these tips for understanding and leveraging our large networks, it begs the question : Can we beat Dunbar's number?

    ;Can we beat Dunbar's number?

    ;

    ;Some people can beat Dunbar's number, but not everyone can.

    ;

    ;“It is possible to have more than 150 contacts, but not all of them will be meaningful or close relationships,” shared ;Bayu Prihandito; worked with a client who seemed to have beaten Dunbar's number.

    ;

    ;He shared that the client seemed to juggle connections beyond 150, but upon closer inspection, the depth of these relationships greatly varied.

    ;

    ;As it turns out, the varying depth can benefit you when pursuing professional relationships.

    ;

    ;“In a professional environment, we often engage in relationships that are defined by specific goals or shared interests rather than deep emotional connections,” said Lachlan Brown. “These relationships could theoretically extend beyond Dunbar's number because they don't require ;the same cognitive load ;as personal connections.”

    ;Networking in the online space can feel even lonelier. You'd be hard-pressed to find a colleague who just walks away from a one-on-one conversation without saying a word, but you'll experience it often in online networking.

    ;

    ;“80% of people will ignore you. Don't let that get to you,” said Nicolas Garfinkel, founder of ;Mindful Conversion;. “People are overloaded with connections, and many people don't want to network.没关系。 Just keep putting in the time, and good things will happen.”

      • ;
    • ;Network ;growth ;(connection and follower count on LinkedIn).

    • ;The number of conversations you manage to move ;off-platform; (coffee chats).

    ;How to Maintain Your Network

    ;

    ;Put your newfound understanding of networking on social media into action with these tips.

    ;

    ;;

    ;

    ;1. Create a schedule.

    ;

    ;Consistency isn't something that accidentally happens on its own; it requires a schedule.

    ;

    ;“Plan time each week to focus on creating and maintaining connections,” Lily Zay advises. “Keeping up with networking connections consistently helps maintain a larger network without leaving you scrambling to reach out to hundreds of people at once.”

    ;

    ;If you're not sure where to start, try this schedule. For 15 minutes each morning:

    ;
      ;
    • ;;Engage with your current connections on LinkedIn;. Respond to DMs and comments on your posts. Leave new comments on posts that are in your feed.
      • ;
    • ;;Grow your network;. Comment on posts from people you don't know, send them thoughtful connection requests, and engage with new people online.
      • ;
    ;

    ;Maintain this schedule even on the weekends. LinkedIn is still an extremely active place on Saturday and Sunday (search the hashtag #SocialSaturday, and you'll be blown away).

    ;

    ;It's even easier to have conversations when the platform is less crowded. Plus, your connections' notifications aren't as busy.

    ;

    ;2. Explore different channels.

    ;

    ;While we're looking a lot at LinkedIn, networking and relationships can be found on several platforms. Each platform often comes with different benefits:

    ;
      ;
    • ;;LinkedIn;, ease, mutual goals.
      • ;
    • ;;Slack;, specific audience.
      • ;
    • ;;TikTok;, timeliness.
      • ;
    • ;;Email;, long-form communications, accessibility.
      • ;
    • ;;Facebook groups;, specific audience.
      • ;
    • ;;Voxer;, conversational nature.
      • ;
    ;

    ;If you have multifaceted relationships, consider giving each appendage of your relationship a specific platform. For example, two friends collaborating on consulting work can keep their professional communications limited to only email.

    ;

    ;3. Segment your network.

    ;

    ;Instead of seeing your network as one whole unit group of 150 people, segment groups and create a hierarchy.

    ;

    ;“I categorize my network into various groups,” said ;Jessie van Breugel;, LinkedIn inbound specialist. “Segmenting my network allows me to allocate my time and resources more efficiently.”

    ;

    ;Jessie segments his networking into these three groups:

    ;
      ;
    • ;;Inner circle;, close peers, mentors, and partners.
      • ;
    • ;;Professional acquaintances;, people he's worked with or met at events but doesn't communicate with regularly.
      • ;
    • ;;Casual contacts;, those he's met briefly or knows of but hasn't established a deep connection with.
      • ;
    ;

    ;Understanding these layers of your 150 connections can make relationship maintenance more realistic.

    ;
    ;
    ;
    ; ;
    ;
    ;
    ;

    ;4. Get organized.

    ;

    ;Just as commitment doesn't happen independently, organization is also not an accident.

    ;

    ;Consider using popular tools to stay organized around your networking efforts:

    ;
      ;
    1. ;Client relationship management (CRM) software.
      2. ;
    2. ;Productivity tools like ;Notion; and ;Trello;.
      3. ;
    3. ;Spreadsheets.
      4. ;
    ;

    ;Track goals, essential contacts, and your progress toward those goals. These goals can be non-transactional, such as having 10 coffee chats per month, or they can be measurable, such as signing one new client through LinkedIn.

    ;

    ;Other goal outcomes may be longer-term, which makes organization even more important. If you're pursuing a relationship for a specific reason, identify your goal and track your progress toward building that relationship.

    ;

    ;For example, a writer trying to get a book deal with Penguin Random House may try to connect with editors on LinkedIn and build relationships for six months before bringing up the topic of their own book.

    ;

    ;Staying organized around your goals for your networking efforts will help improve your odds of reaching them.

    ;

    ;5. Meet in groups.

    ;

    ;While most networking takes place one-on-one, there's also huge value in contact groups.

    ;

    ;“As you grow your career, your network gets larger — to not lose the personal touch, it comes down to how you manage your time,” said Joshua Host, founder of ;Thrivelab;, who oversees 100+ team members.

    ;

    ;“For example, business owners can schedule meetings with specific departments, and entrepreneurs can massage business connections by grouping contacts into a call who are involved in the same venture.”

    ;

    ;A hidden benefit of grouping in the networking space is the authority building. Six months into your networking efforts, schedule a few calls tying together related professionals who may have overlapping interests or personalities.

    ;

    ;This makes you a conductor for introductions and an extremely valuable person for anyone else to have in their network.

    ;

    ;6. Manage your time, and you'll manage your relationships.

    ;

    ;With emails, messages, video calls, and notifications always in the palm of our hands, it's easy to get swept downstream in the excitement and forgo boundaries with your extended network.

    ;

    ;It turns out it's to our detriment.

    ;

    ;“My best tip to anyone looking to get 'out of the work zone' and focus on their relationships is to limit your work hours. And stick to that,” shared ;Jasmin (Jay) Alić;, who has been ranked as the top creator on LinkedIn.

    ;
    ;
    ;
    ; ;
    ;
    ;
    ;

    ;After growing his network on LinkedIn to more than 100,000 followers, Jay shared this advice for building your network: “If you can find 2-3 hours in your day and make that your work-free zone every single day, you can keep any relationship going.”

    ;

    ;Have you been inspired to grow your network today? Let any nervousness, uncertainty, or lack of urgency be wiped out by Adam Connors' words:

    ;

    ;“There is no better investment than in your friendship 401K. You will get a massive ROR (return on relationships). The compound interest is incalculable.”

    ;

    ;Don't get too wrapped up in the number of friends or contacts you have; focus on the quality, and you (and your career) will feel the impact.

    ;2. Justin Quis Quis，神圣 Bev

    ;;Justin Quis Quis; 花了很长时间作为加利福尼亚州圣贝纳迪诺附近的圣曼努埃尔宣教印第安人乐队的领导成员。当他帮助领导部落的时间即将结束时，他知道自己想要继续前进并开拓新的领域。

    ;

    ;在这种情况下，它是功能性饮料 - 想想能量饮料或花草茶。 Quis Quis 看到了功能性饮料市场的爆炸式增长，并看到了 Native 存在的空间。他确定了可以在产品中利用土著传统思维的地方，同时呼吁人们注意土著人民仍然是现代生活的一部分这一事实。

    ;

    ;“我们很兴奋，”他说。 “我们真的觉得我们手上有一件好事，而且我们得到了一些非常积极的评价。我们已经获得了 14 个个人账户，其中一些是部落的，一些是非预订的，我们还获得了一个经销商，该经销商已向小型超市和杂货店发送了数百箱货物。我们通过了 IAC 的认证。这些饮料非常受欢迎。”

    ;这些饮料非常受欢迎，值得考虑谁最终会领导 Sacred Bev，Quis Quis 对此也有想法。 Quis Quis 的许多合作伙伴和投资者都是他在圣曼努埃尔领导期间的其他部落或同事。此外，他已开始与其他部落接触，希望从尽可能多的本土来源采购饮料原料（采用仙人掌、黑莓和石榴等天然香料）。

    ;3。 Joe Valandra，部落就绪

    ;

    ;在这些机会之后，咨询公司和承包商如雨后春笋般涌现，帮助将资金送到需要的地方。瓦兰德拉希望利用他在印第安乡村作为承包商、博彩运营商以及美洲原住民的历史，确保部落能够用自己的钱获得最好的工作。

    ;

    ;为此， Valandra 于 2023 年 1 月成立了咨询公司 ;Tribal Ready;。他表示，该公司成立的前六个月是“一阵旋风”。 Tribal Ready 与技术平台 Ready.net 合作，帮助部落弄清楚从哪种网络最适合他们的需求，到在扩建之前进行可行性谈判和环境影响研究。

    ;

    ;有时，这意味着帮助部落建立新的社区他们的预订上的提供商服务并接管。瓦兰德拉说，有时，这意味着管理相关部落的提供商或购买附近的提供商，将其现有服务扩展到一个新的领域，重点支持原住民。

    ;

    ;无论最终安排如何，部落都应该他补充说，他们对自己的连接基础设施和服务拥有尽可能多的控制权。

    ;

    ;“在过去 50 年里，联邦政府提供了大量资金来改善农村连接，但其中很少实际上是在印第安乡村看到的，”瓦兰德拉说。 “毫无疑问，对于部落来说，控制为其成员提供支持和提供宽带服务的基础设施绝对至关重要。”

    ;;为什么使用 TikTok 来开发潜在客户？;

    ; < p>;TikTok 可以成为产生新潜在客户的绝佳平台，有几个充分的理由：

    ;

    ;;1.它允许移动优先的活动。 ;

    ;

    ;TikTok 优先考虑短视频，尽管用户可以上传和观看 10 分钟的视频。

    ;

    ;这使得该平台成为移动优先活动的绝佳渠道，因为短视频-form 视频预计将占北美;所有移动数据流量的 80%;。

    ;

    ;该平台允许用户通过手机连续滚动几个小时的视频，并订阅他们最喜欢的 TikTok 帐户。

    ;

    ;此外，从运营的角度来看，移动格式也是相关的。您可以直接通过手机开展业务，因此投资 TikTok 等基于移动的应用程序可以非常适合您的移动优先营销活动。

    ;

    ;;2.这对于瞄准年轻市场的品牌来说非常有用。;

    ;

    ;根据 ;YPulse;，超过 75% 的 Z 世代使用 TikTok，并且近三分之二的人每天都使用它。此外，得益于该应用，许多 Z 世代对产品感到好奇或做出购买决定。

    ;

    ;例如，一项研究显示，在观看 TikTok 上的动态展示广告（该平台上的一种视频广告）后，74% 的 Z 世代每周 TikTok 用户会寻求有关广告产品的更多信息。

    ;

    ;更好的是，;46% 的 Z 世代 TikTok 用户; 购买了某种产品，因为他们在过去一年中在 TikTok 上看到了该产品。

    ;

    ;此信息对于试图吸引年轻受众的企业主至关重要。毕竟，Z世代将是未来最具购买力的市场。

    ;

    ;据彭博社报道，年轻一代的购买力已达 3600 亿美元，而四年前为 1430 亿美元。< /p>;

    ;;3.它使您的品牌能够制作真实的内容。;

    ;

    ;除了对业务的工作理解之外，经理还需要在内部和外部建立富有成效的专业关系，以便成为更真实、更可靠的品牌大使。

    ;建立和维护社区。;

    ;社区管理者负责建立和维护品牌的社区（线上和线下）以及公众认知。

    ;

    ;这项工作需要通过各种渠道吸引受众，包括在线论坛、社交媒体平台、Slack、面对面小组等，以接触到所有受众。

    ;由于不同的数字媒体空间有独特的文化和最佳实践，社区管理者必须是品牌的一致语气和声音。

    ;正如 Krystal Wu 指出的，“当我说话时，我是在为 HubSpot 打电话。我不是 Krystal，我是 HubSpot。”

    ;Keeping Momentum in December -- and Beyond

    ;

    ;The opportunity for retailers doesn't end with Cyber 5, the peak deal period from Black Friday through Cyber Monday.

    ;

    ;According to a Mastercard analysis we ran with BCG from October 2022 through January, 46% of US consumer holiday spending occurred between Cyber Monday and Christmas Eve in 2022. These shoppers also spent over $47 billion in retail in the two weeks after December 25th. 

    ;

    ;So what's driving consumer demand in December and January? We partnered with ;Ipsos; on a few surveys between October 2022 and January 2023 to find out:

    ;

    ;In December, shoppers are more motivated than ever to finish holiday shopping. Last year, the average US shopper still had 50% of their shopping left to do after "Cyber 5." Gen Z-ers had even more left to complete than other generations. [4] 

    ;

    ;By January, consumers can now shop for their own enjoyment and less-so out of gift obligations. According to our data, ;50% of consumers enjoy shopping shortly after Christmas.;

    ;

    ;Connecting with Customers Across Touchpoints

    ;

    ;In-store shopping climbed to record heights last year, topping ;$1 trillion; for the first time ever.

    ;

    ;A key driver behind these high rates of brick-and-mortar shopping is shoppers' use of digital resources before going to a physical shop. These digital offerings are helpful to in both deciding on and fulfilling them. 

    ;

    ;One company that saw this was cosmetics chain, ;Ulta Beauty;, who spoke with Google about their holiday performance:

    ;

    ;;

    ;

    ;We also see consumers increasingly tapping into multiple digital channels over the course of the season.

    ;

    ;An online study we ran with Ipsos from October 2022 through January 2023 revealed more than half of shoppers used five or more channels, like video and social media, to shop over a two-day period in 2022. That proportion of shoppers increased in December.

    ;

    ;And we actually see shoppers use even more digital resources to make purchases after the height of the holiday season, with the average number of digital resources used increasing post-holiday. From our research, we see that this includes Google properties, like Search, Maps, Youtube, whose already high usage throughout the season increases significantly post-Christmas.

    ;

    ;Not only are shoppers continuing to shop, but they're shopping across more digital properties. This means brands that use omnichannel experiences to connect with customers across touchpoints can stand out from the crowd.

    ;

    ;Build Long-Term Brand Loyalty.

    ;

    ;In a Google-commissioned study we ran this October, we learned there's an even larger opportunity to build long-term brand loyalty, especially as almost half (47%) of shoppers say the time after Christmas enables them to shop for brands they love. 

    ;

    ;Consider promoting loyalty or rewards programs, which are top of mind for shoppers during this period.

    ;

    ;In January 2023, we observed a noteworthy ;50% surge in search interest regarding loyalty programs;, which includes searches like 'reward program' and 'loyalty points', compared to December 2022.[11]

    ;

    ;In data we gathered between September 2022 and January 2023, we also saw the search volume for gift-related queries, like 'gifts' and 'presents,' remained high in January 2023 — a 45% and 15% increase compared to the early holiday months of September 2022 and October 2022, respectively.

    ;Upload, Edit, and Post an Image

    ;

    ;Now, for the most important part of Instagram — ;how to upload and post an image.;

    ;

    ;Instagram is an entirely visual platform. Unlike Facebook, which relies on both text and pictures, or Twitter, which relies on text alone, Instagram's sole purpose is to enable users to share images or videos with their audience.

    ;

    ;On Facebook, you might choose to post 100 photos on an album. On Instagram, you need to be choosier about which photos you post. There are a few reasons for this — first, you don't want to post more than once a day (typically). And you don't want to post too many similar photos.

    ;

    ;For instance, it would be odd for you to post fifty photos from the same beach vacation on your Instagram profile. Instead, you might choose five or six, and place them all within the same post.

    ;

    ;(These are called ;carousel posts;, and they allow you to share multiple photos in one post only. Carousel posts are awesome for posting similar pictures in one package while keeping your overall profile aesthetic diverse.)
